channel.title: PORT FORWARDING with a Laptop
channel.description: Im trying to make my first RSPS and well its a 317 like it runs its all good just need to code some more(if theres another server to DL thats already coded or got quit a bit done can someone tell me and can be newer than 317,prefer newer). I cant seem to port forward with my laptop I dont know why. I even went to portforward.com and didnt help me, I followed the steps to the exact and nothing happened. Any help anyone?

item.title: PORT FORWARDING with a Laptop
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Maybe your isp doesn’t allow portforwarding or you not doing something right.

Read full topic

item.title: PORT FORWARDING with a Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Rene_eats_waffl3z Rene eats waffl3z
item.description:
@Rene_eats_waffl3z wrote:

It doesn’t matter if you use a laptop or not. All you have to do is sign into your router and enable the ports for your specific device.

Good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: PORT FORWARDING with a Laptop
item.dc:creator: @lucky22 lucky22
item.description:
@lucky22 wrote:

LOL dont get so pissed dude I have watched over 100hours of videos and read like a novel on how to port forward all have different things so i do them all and doesnt work. Thought I would post on here to see if anything helps.

Read full topic

item.title: PORT FORWARDING with a Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Kastro1 Kastro_
item.description:
@Kastro1 wrote:

It’s so frustrating when people have made the tutorials which a lot of people ask, all they need to do is get of their ass and actually look instead of wanting to be spoon-fed.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Have a read, this covers everything on how you can start of your own RSPS. Once you’ve followed all the guidelines, and completed everything then I’d advise you read up on some Java-documents just so you can understand the concept of programming.

Read full topic

item.title: PORT FORWARDING with a Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

If you really, really cant portfoward. I reccommend keep trying though because it is very easy.

Just download bittorrent or Utorrent.

Go to Options> Preferences >Connection Tab> Change that Port to 43594.

Still recommend to portfoward through router.

Hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: PORT FORWARDING with a Laptop
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

portforwarding is for the most part the easiest thing you can do these days, most routers have an easy to us UI that should bring you to the portforwarding / porttriggering sections. All you have to do is get your ip, given to you by the router for the most part it will start with 192.168.1.(###), the last number is the most important number to know since that is the only real difference between you and another device within your network.

You can get your ip within the command line on windows by using the command “ipconfig”. It will print out in the terminal all the devices you have connected, the one you need is your default ip / ipv4 or the ip that is right above the gateway ip, not the subnet mask!. Again the most likely ip will be 192.168.1.###.

You will now use this with the port forwarding form you will have to fill out in your routers web based configuration tool.

Once you’re down you will now need to add both ports (43594, 5555) to your firewalls exceptions and allow incoming and outgoing packets, if you don’t your firewall will block it, you will need to do the same if your anti-virus includes a firewall in it.

Read full topic

item.title: PORT FORWARDING with a Laptop
item.dc:creator: @bhl_simple bhl simple
item.description:
@bhl_simple wrote:

if you cant portfoward even with the help of portforward.com then its hopeless for you.
